revised_title: Toxicity and Effects of the Poison Wood Tree in New England
tldr: The article describes the Poison Wood Tree, also known as Swamp Sumach, which grows in swamps and has toxic properties. It can cause poisoning through contact or inhalation, affecting some individuals more than others. Symptoms include itching, inflammation, and swelling, but the poison is not usually fatal and typically subsides within a few days.
